node.title: New Jersey Cop Who Killed Pedestrian, Took Body Home, Was Turned In By Father: Prosecutor
node.alt: A New Jersey police officer who allegedly killed a pedestrian and took their body home was turned In by his father, the lead prosecutor in the case has said. In this photo, law enforcement officers secure the area where they allegedly arrested terror suspect Ahmad Khan Rahami following a shootout in Linden, New Jersey, on September 19, 2016.
node.description: The cop's lawyer said the pedestrian was wearing a werewolf costume and walking against the flow of highway traffic when the collision occurred.
node.content:
["A New Jersey police officer who allegedly killed a pedestrian and took their body home was turned in by his father, said a lead prosecutor.", "Louis Santiago, a 25-year-old Newark police officer, allegedly struck Damian Dymka, a 29-year-old nurse, with his vehicle at 3 a.m. on Monday, November 1. Santiago was off-duty when the alleged collision occurred.", "Santiago didn't call 911 for emergency assistance nor did he stop to help Dymka, Acting Essex County Prosecutor Theodore Stephens wrote in a press statement.", "Instead, Santiago allegedly \"returned to the scene multiple times\" before eventually removing Dymka's body and transporting it home in his vehicle, according to Stephens.", "", "
A New Jersey police officer who allegedly killed a pedestrian and took their body home was turned In by his father, the lead prosecutor in the case has said. In this photo, law enforcement officers secure the area where they allegedly arrested terror suspect Ahmad Khan Rahami following a shootout in Linden, New Jersey, on September 19, 2016.
", "Santiago's father, a lieutenant in the Newark Police Department, called 911 and reported his son's accident, Stephens said.", "When New Jersey State Police arrived, they found Dymka dead in the back seat of Santiago's car.", "Santiago was arrested and charged with reckless vehicular homicide, leaving the scene of a crash resulting in death, endangering an injured victim, desecrating human remains, hindering one's own apprehension, tampering with physical evidence, obstructing the administration of law, two counts of official misconduct, as well as other charges.", "The passenger of his car, Albert Guzman, 25, and Santiago's mother, 53, were also arrested. They were charged with conspiracy to desecrate human remains, hindering apprehension, and conspiracy to hinder apprehension and tamper with physical evidence.", "Santiago's lawyer Patrick Toscano Jr., disputes the charges.", "Toscano said that Dymka had been wearing a werewolf Halloween costume and walking against the flow of highway traffic when the incident occurred. He also contended that Stephens \"tremendously overcharged\" Santiago with alleged criminal offenses over the incident.", "\"There is maybe probable cause for two or three charges, certainly not 12 or 13,\" Toscano told The New York Times.", "Toscano also said that he hadn't seen any evidence suggesting that Santiago had spoken with his mother while at home. Santiago has since been suspended from the local police department, Toscano told the Times.", "An estimated 20,160 people died in motor vehicle crashes during the first half of 2021, according to an October report from the U.S. Department of Transportation. The number represents an 18.4 percent increase over the number of similar deaths recorded in 2020.", "The increase in fatalities were caused by speeding, a lack of seatbelt use and intoxication from alcohol and other drugs, the report said.", "Distracted driving caused by cellphones and other items may have also contributed, though the report said it's hard to measure how often such distractions occur.", "It's unclear if any of these factors played a role in Santiago's incident."]
